intro: Cascabela ovata, commonly known as the round-fruit cascabela, is a member of the Loganiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by oval, yellow fruits that turn orange when ripe. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. Cascabela ovata is often found in moist, shaded habitats and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
